newsitem.title: FRANCE: French shares start one percent higher.
newsitem.headline: French shares start one percent higher.

text.p: French shares started one percent higher on the back of a firmer dollar and gains on Wall Street, dealers said.
"I think we are at the start of a good upward run," said on dealer. However, investors were cautious ahead of the 1230 GMT publication of the March U.S. retail prices.
At 0804, the CAC-40 future was 26.60 points, or 1.04 percent, higher at 2,592.73. CAC April futures were 1.21 percent, or 31 points, higher at 2,594.
Dealers said the futures contract could rise to 2,602 if it broke resistance at 2.595.
* LVMH was 3.96 percent higher at 1,338 francs after it reproted a big rise in first quarter sales. DIOR, up 3.57 percent at 842 franc, followed suit.
* Sports gear group Salomon was up 2.56 percent at 400 francs, continuing a recent rise.
* Coflexip was the biggest faller, down 2.32 percent at 332.10 francs.
* Lyonnaise was 0.18 percent higher at 542 francs while Cie de Suez added 0.77 percent to 288.80.
